segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to something behind her, but she’s too focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting slick, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t heard the water running this whole time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are going to be ruined if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should say something, but I don’t want to startle her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a mess, and it’s only getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
